tags: I really want to see the church scene
summary: taiteilija replied to your post “Teaser thoughts”I have a thought! Not strictly connected to teaser, but... It came to my mind...
body:
taiteilija replied to your post “Teaser thoughts”

I have a thought! Not strictly connected to teaser, but… It came to my mind just now. What if that scene in church, with Crowley, the one mentioned by Gaiman, is in fact the scene that shows how Crowley get that holy water he later used to kill Ligur? :D

Great thinking! I was wondering why would our favourite demon had to go (well… hop) into a church. This might be it :).

summary: I sometimes think of how fandom seems to always portray Aziraphale and Crowley as chronic winos, but then I've just remembered...
body: I sometimes think of how fandom seems to always portray Aziraphale and Crowley as chronic winos, but then I’ve just remembered that after the Apocalypse doesn’t happen and when the delivery driver comes back, he finds them just sitting on the tarmac heavily drinking and that seems to be the way they work through their issues so more power to them I suppose

reblog.comment: I sometimes think of how fandom seems to always portray Aziraphale and Crowley as chronic winos, but then I’ve just remembered that after the Apocalypse doesn’t happen and when the delivery driver comes back, he finds them just sitting on the tarmac heavily drinking and that seems to be the way they work through their issues so more power to them I suppose

blog.name: huntingfreewill
blog.title: huntingfreewill
blog.description:
Welcome on HuntingFreeWill! Name's Amandine, 20, France. Fanfictions writer. SPN Family.

✝ I'm a Dean!Girl, Cas Lover & obsessed by Crowley & Gabriel ✝

My main blog: @huntingfreewill-main

title: Dead man walking
body:
Pairing: Crowley x Reader

Words: 1,390 

A/N: I’m sorry for any mistakes, my native language is not English.

Warning: mention of cancer, mention of death.

Night had fallen and silence was deafening. The boys were sat at the motel they were staying at while Crowley, the crossroads demons was standing in the middle of the room, stunned and silent. He wasn’t expected such news tonight.

It all began a year ago when you first met Crowley. You were hunting with the Winchesters for a few months now and your first meeting with the crossroads demon had gone pretty well. Crowley was flirting with and joking around while the brothers were annoyed. Quickly, Crowley took a liking to you and you liked his company too.

But then, you suddenly stopped hunting. You left the boys and Crowley had been confused about it. But no one wanted to tell him anything about it, the mystery about your departure making leaving him confused and a tiny bit worried.

Two days ago, he visited the Winchesters and saw you. You were back and he was a little hurt that no one had told him or had to explain to him why you had been gone in the first place. You barely exchanged a word, you quickly looked at him before running out of the room.

Since then, he’s been thinking a lot. He realized that your absence had been hurting him a lot, in a lot of different ways. He’s been angrier lately, more tired too. He’s been thinking of more often and less concentrated on his work. He’s been wondering why you had left until he was thinking it was his fault. Well, you’ve been avoiding him, so it should have been something he had said, no?

What has he done for you to avoid him? To disappear from his life? He had thought that you actually like him… To be sure and to stop the torment he’d put himself in, he went to the Winchesters and demanded answers.

“Y/N has cancer.” Sam finally admitted.

That was why Crowley was standing in this motel room with the boys, perfectly silent. The words seemed to not register at first in his confused and blurred out mind. He didn’t want to admit that was what actually said Sam. He must have heard him wrong. It couldn’t be.

“What?” He finally managed to ask. His voice was so full of worried and fear that he sounded strange to him.

“She has cancer. Brain cancer. Very rare, impossible to treat or to operate.” Dean sighed. For once, he was feeling sympathy for the demon. He’s been in the same state when you had told them the news. They knew you were ill, you were feeling strange and tired lately. That was why you had left, you were taking tests.

“But, how..” Crowley stammered, he didn’t really know what to say. “How can no one has ever seen it before?”

“Don’t know…” Sam sighed too. “Y/N’s been feeling really tired lately and she was having blackout and blanks. So she went to see a doctor. That’s why she disappeared.”

“And no one can heal her?”

“No.”

“Call you angel. He can save her.” Crowley insisted. And right after the words fell from his mouth, an awkward silence fell in the room once more. “What?” He asked, confused, feeling that something was wrong.

“Y/N… She doesn’t want to be saved or healed.”

“I’m sorry, what?”

“She said that she didn’t want to be healed. No angel’s grace nor spell. She doesn’t want to, and I’m quoting her, be saved while others won’t have the same luck as her”

“She doesn’t want to have privilege.”

Crowley actually stayed speechless a moment. “Wh-what? But this is insane?”

“I know, right?” Dean scoffed.

“But this is her choice, and we should respect it.” Sam said wisely.

“No way.” Crowley growled, before disappearing from the room. He reappeared a moment later outside of a bar, where he knew you were. He waited a moment for you to walked out. When you did, you immediately saw him and sighed, frustrated. It was easy to guess what he was here.

“Let me guess, they told you.” You stated, approaching him.

“Y/N, are you insane? Why would you refuse a chance like that? The angel in the trenchcoat could heal you in a matter of second.”

“It’s not that easy.”

“We could make a deal. I could save you.”

You stayed silent a moment too. Touched by the proposition. “Crowley…” You sighed. “It’s kind of you to propose this. I’m touch, really. But I won’t make a deal.”

“But why? You’re going to let yourself die?”

“Yes.”

“I won’t let that happen.”

The day after that, he came back to you, proposing the same deal and you refused once again. The same pattern repeated itself for weeks. Crowley was desperate to make you accept. He didn’t want you to die, he didn’t want to lose you.

“Why are you doing this?” He asked you once. He was standing in front of you, proposing the same deal to you once again.

“I don’t want to be saved, Crowley. I don’t want to live knowing I’ve been saved while others won’t. I don’t want to have this privilege. This is a chance for me to have a normal death. No demons, nor vampire. Just cancer.”

“It’s crazy…”

“It isn’t for me.”

“I don’t want you to die.” He confessed suddenly, sadness overwhelming him.

“I don’t want to either. But this is what being Humans mean. We live and then we die.”

Crowley didn’t stop coming for you, he kept asking and asking again, hoping you will one day accept his deal. You never.

One day, Crowley’s been summoned. When he appeared, he was surprised to see you. You were looking so weak. You were thin and pale. You looked tired too.

“Y/N?” He asked, surprised to see you. He was surprised to see the state you were in too. And deeply, he was hoping that you would accept his deal, finally.

“Hi, Crowley.” Your voice was as weak as you looked and it broke his heart.

“Why did you summoned me?”

“I was hoping to tell you goodbye.”

“Goodbye?”

“It’s time Crowley, I can feel it. I’m dying.”

“No.” He said desperately. You looked sadly at him and opened your arms. You hugged him tightly as tight as your weak arms would allow you. You face was hidden in the crook of his neck and you allowed some tears to run down your cheeks. You’ve been so strong during all of this. You hide how afraid you were actually feeling. But tonight, it was the end and you could finally let it go.

Crowley hugged you tight too, hoping you were going to change your mind at the last minute. But then, he felt your body going limp in his arms and he felt your last breath on his neck.

“Y/N?” He panicked, helping you safely to the ground. “Y/N!”

Your eyes were closed, dried tears on your cheeks. Your skin was pale, and already getting cold. Crowley looked at you, letting his tears running down his face. He knew it was your choice, he knew you wanted this but he couldn’t help but think that, as a crossroads demon, he had failed. He should have done this deal with you.

FOREVER LIST

@dekahg @ria132love @emiwrites3reads @luciferstempest

Words: 1,390 

A/N: I’m sorry for any mistakes, my native language is not English.

Since then, he’s been thinking a lot. He realized that your absence had been hurting him a lot, in a lot of different ways. He’s been angrier lately, more tired too. He’s been thinking of more often and less concentrated on his work. He’s been wondering why you had left until he was thinking it was his fault. Well, you’ve been avoiding him, so it should have been something he had said, no?

What has he done for you to avoid him? To disappear from his life? He had thought that you actually like him… To be sure and to stop the torment he’d put himself in, he went to the Winchesters and demanded answers.

“Y/N has cancer.” Sam finally admitted.

That was why Crowley was standing in this motel room with the boys, perfectly silent. The words seemed to not register at first in his confused and blurred out mind. He didn’t want to admit that was what actually said Sam. He must have heard him wrong. It couldn’t be.

“What?” He finally managed to ask. His voice was so full of worried and fear that he sounded strange to him.

“She has cancer. Brain cancer. Very rare, impossible to treat or to operate.” Dean sighed. For once, he was feeling sympathy for the demon. He’s been in the same state when you had told them the news. They knew you were ill, you were feeling strange and tired lately. That was why you had left, you were taking tests.

“But, how..” Crowley stammered, he didn’t really know what to say. “How can no one has ever seen it before?”

“Don’t know…” Sam sighed too. “Y/N’s been feeling really tired lately and she was having blackout and blanks. So she went to see a doctor. That’s why she disappeared.”

“And no one can heal her?”

“No.”

“Call you angel. He can save her.” Crowley insisted. And right after the words fell from his mouth, an awkward silence fell in the room once more. “What?” He asked, confused, feeling that something was wrong.

“Y/N… She doesn’t want to be saved or healed.”

“I’m sorry, what?”

“She said that she didn’t want to be healed. No angel’s grace nor spell. She doesn’t want to, and I’m quoting her, be saved while others won’t have the same luck as her”

“She doesn’t want to have privilege.”

Crowley actually stayed speechless a moment. “Wh-what? But this is insane?”

“I know, right?” Dean scoffed.

“But this is her choice, and we should respect it.” Sam said wisely.

“No way.” Crowley growled, before disappearing from the room. He reappeared a moment later outside of a bar, where he knew you were. He waited a moment for you to walked out. When you did, you immediately saw him and sighed, frustrated. It was easy to guess what he was here.

“Let me guess, they told you.” You stated, approaching him.

“Y/N, are you insane? Why would you refuse a chance like that? The angel in the trenchcoat could heal you in a matter of second.”

“It’s not that easy.”

“We could make a deal. I could save you.”

You stayed silent a moment too. Touched by the proposition. “Crowley…” You sighed. “It’s kind of you to propose this. I’m touch, really. But I won’t make a deal.”

“But why? You’re going to let yourself die?”

“Yes.”

“I won’t let that happen.”

The day after that, he came back to you, proposing the same deal and you refused once again. The same pattern repeated itself for weeks. Crowley was desperate to make you accept. He didn’t want you to die, he didn’t want to lose you.

“Why are you doing this?” He asked you once. He was standing in front of you, proposing the same deal to you once again.

“I don’t want to be saved, Crowley. I don’t want to live knowing I’ve been saved while others won’t. I don’t want to have this privilege. This is a chance for me to have a normal death. No demons, nor vampire. Just cancer.”

“It’s crazy…”

“It isn’t for me.”

“I don’t want you to die.” He confessed suddenly, sadness overwhelming him.

“I don’t want to either. But this is what being Humans mean. We live and then we die.”

Crowley didn’t stop coming for you, he kept asking and asking again, hoping you will one day accept his deal. You never.

One day, Crowley’s been summoned. When he appeared, he was surprised to see you. You were looking so weak. You were thin and pale. You looked tired too.

“Y/N?” He asked, surprised to see you. He was surprised to see the state you were in too. And deeply, he was hoping that you would accept his deal, finally.

“Hi, Crowley.” Your voice was as weak as you looked and it broke his heart.

“Why did you summoned me?”

“I was hoping to tell you goodbye.”

“Goodbye?”

“It’s time Crowley, I can feel it. I’m dying.”

“No.” He said desperately. You looked sadly at him and opened your arms. You hugged him tightly as tight as your weak arms would allow you. You face was hidden in the crook of his neck and you allowed some tears to run down your cheeks. You’ve been so strong during all of this. You hide how afraid you were actually feeling. But tonight, it was the end and you could finally let it go.

Crowley hugged you tight too, hoping you were going to change your mind at the last minute. But then, he felt your body going limp in his arms and he felt your last breath on his neck.

“Y/N?” He panicked, helping you safely to the ground. “Y/N!”

Your eyes were closed, dried tears on your cheeks. Your skin was pale, and already getting cold. Crowley looked at you, letting his tears running down his face. He knew it was your choice, he knew you wanted this but he couldn’t help but think that, as a crossroads demon, he had failed. He should have done this deal with you.

FOREVER LIST

@dekahg @ria132love @emiwrites3reads @luciferstempest
trail.content_abstract:
Pairing: Crowley x Reader

Words: 1,390 

A/N: I’m sorry for any mistakes, my native language is not English.

Warning: mention of cancer, mention of death.

Night had fallen and silence was deafening. The boys were sat at the motel they were staying at while Crowley, the crossroads demons was standing in the middle of the room, stunned and silent. He wasn’t expected such news tonight.

It all began a year ago when you first met Crowley. You were hunting with the Winchesters for a few months now and your first meeting with the crossroads demon had gone pretty well. Crowley was flirting with and joking around while the brothers were annoyed. Quickly, Crowley took a liking to you and you liked his company too.

But then, you suddenly stopped hunting. You left the boys and Crowley had been confused about it. But no one wanted to tell him anything about it, the mystery about your departure making leaving him confused and a tiny bit worried.

blog.name: irisbleufic
blog.title: (lives between pages)
blog.description: Holistic Writer / INTJ / Chaotic Good / Slytherin / Jewish / QIA-spec in LGBTQIA+ / autistic rabblerouser / still in my 30s / they-pronouns. Emma Goldman stan. Survivor of traumas I only discuss when relevant. Contains black tea, insomnia, poetry, & fic—but mostly just fic. If you're looking for CoT 'Verse and the rest of my Good Omens fic, you can find it here. As of 2013, all of my old LJ-era fanfiction has been uploaded to AO3. I'm the nutter behind @ask-agnes-nutter, so feel free to send asks. I moderate for the largest, most active GO Discord server, The Ritz; if you would like an invite, please DM me. You can pester me; I strongly encourage anons, because I know not everyone finds sending asks easy. If you want to know where to find my published work, email me on irisbleufic@gmail.com or send a DM. If you make art based on my writing, podfic my stories, or do anything you want me to see, tag it #irisbleufic. I won’t tell folks they shouldn't follow, but there's complex content here. I tag thoroughly. You can ko-fi me if you wish.

summary: Hi Iris, I have a Good Omens question: at what part of the book does It say that Crowley and Az share a cottage? I just bought...
question: Hi Iris, I have a Good Omens question: at what part of the book does It say that Crowley and Az share a cottage? I just bought my copy and I didn't find it hehe
answer:
Hi, anon. You won’t have found it in the book, because it’s not in the book. Here’s the very short version: Neil mentioned in a blog post in early 2005 that he and Terry had recently met to catch up, and they had a conversation in which they mused on what Aziraphale and Crowley were up to. Neil only quoted part of what they decided, namely that it involved them being in the South Downs. A number of us on the lower_tadfield LJ community became wickedly curious about what they could possibly be doing. When I learned both Neil and Terry would be doing readings/Q&As in my then-city (Boston/Cambridge) in September that year, and within a week of each other, I snagged tickets to both events. I promised the l_t folks that if I happened to get called on at both Q&A sessions, I’d ask each author the same question. Thanks to my very noticeable ginger/copper hair, I think, I did get called on at both. Terry gave a charmingly rambling answer about the process of writing GO, but didn’t actually answer my precise question (What did you two decide A&C are doing in the South Downs?) Neil, on the other hand, gave a very similar rambling answer, and then paused and ended with, “But no, what we decided they’re doing in the South Downs is sharing a cottage.” TL;DR it’s a response from one of the authors about an idle speculation in a conversation they had, which I then turned around and used as a writing prompt (it’s what became my long series referred to as CoT in popular shorthand, and other fan creators have also followed suit and used it as a prompt in the years since). I have a longer post or two on this somewhere that include links back to LJ from the time; I’m in a rush now, but I’ll link them here later.  They contain more detail than this explanation.

ETA: The Tumblr posts in question are here and here.  I made them when, on two previous occasions, I got similar questions.  It’s been a wild 14 - 15 years, and I’m still sort of blown away that a neat confluence of circumstances, minor in the grander scheme of things, led to such an impact on my fandom presence (and on my writing life, too).

summary: I Love My Lover With A--
title: I Love My Lover With A--
body:
read it on the AO3 at https://ift.tt/2TuGqje

by DictionaryWrites

“I love my lover with an A,” Aziraphale murmured against his hip, his fingers playing over the sides of Crowley’s handsome knees, “because he is Adversarial. Because he is Avaricious; Atrocious.”

“Because he is Adoring,” Crowley murmured, albeit tiredly, and Aziraphale smiled, laying more kisses upon the light, athletic muscle of Crowley’s thigh. “Because he is Ardent; Amatory.”

summary: Bisexual mechanic Rose Tyler restoring Crowley's burnt husk of a Bentley is really the only follow-up to Good Omens that I'll...
body:
Bisexual mechanic Rose Tyler restoring Crowley’s burnt husk of a Bentley is really the only follow-up to Good Omens that I’ll accept.

(Edit: I’d write this, but alas, cars are literally so baffling to me that there’s no way I could make the jargon work.)
